title: Student Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fordham University (Bronx, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It is a very easy interview process, you first apply for the position, and then you have an interview with your future supervisor where she asks you questions to ensure you are qualified for the job.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in being a Coordinator?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy. Had one phone interview and one zoom interview with basic questions. Receptive to questions and easy to navigate conversation. So so so so so so so easy
Interview Questions: Why work here at Fordham?

title: Sports Information Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth and the team was really helpful in answering any questions you may have. They made sure to clearly define the role and duties at hand.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you were flexible/adaptable?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fordham University in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: all they ask was just filling out the google form. wait for a couple of days, they will get back to you with paperwork that you have to fill out in order to get your paycheck, such as i94, tax form.
Interview Questions: How many hours are you willing to work

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: Convenient on-campus interview planned around my class schedule, questions about my major, work experience, ideas I had for the job, and skills I could bring to the role, and scheduling availability
Interview Questions: Describe your leadership experience on campus.

title: Executive Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed in-person with the Department Chair and primary Executive Secretary. The experience was very pleasant and personal, in an informal setting. Questions focused on technical skills and motivation. Received very positive feedback and a response shortly after the interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with our department. What motivates you and what are your long-term career goals.

title: Sr. Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was three interviews. Met with managers and team.  The interview was very easy and was able to speak with others about the role.  Went in toured on campus and discussed information roles and department.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?  Tell me about your management experience.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was super long. It took 3 months for them to offer me the job and finish the interviews. Group interviews over zoom, people were nice and eager to answer all my questions. Wish it was a more finely experience but still a positive one.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Fordham?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: Everything was straight to the point and very professional.  The standards are high working for a private higher education university. As long as you truly grasp what Fordham University and their core principals are you should do well during the interview process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Fordham University?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward, friendly, informative. Both people I interviewed with were extremely nice and very knowledgable about the role and about the university and what would be expected of someone in the role.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience using Creative Suite?

title: Director of Campus and Community Engagement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call on a Friday at 4.30 pm asking for a phone interview.  I called on Monday at 9.30 am and spoke with the recruiter. Please see below for more detailed information on our conversation.
Interview Questions: What kind of salary are you looking for?

title: IT Support Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: She decided to give everyone a chance to meet her and talk. I just introduced myself and that's all. She seems tired and then she went through the job duties and how it's gonna proceed after I passed my 1st interview but I didn't pass lol
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself . . . .

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: It was really great. They made me feel comfortable and asked if I needed water. They asked a lot of great questions. Professor interviews are pretty standard as long as you have the right credentials.
Interview Questions: Why are you passionate about teaching this subject?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: Honestly not bad. They asked why I wanted to tutor and what my grades were. There was only one interview but also got the job through speaking to a professor.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be tutor

title: Communications Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: Multi-tier interview process starting with a phone and then in person.  Group of about 5. Very receptive and good communication and the department was nice. Interview was more conversational versus scripted questions which I prefer but could have just been. The style for this role. Didn’t end up working out but not a bad experience.
Interview Questions: How my current experience would translate to that particular role. Also technical skills.

title: MSQF Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward. The interviewer was nice. We connected on Skype and he just asked questions that were essential for understanding this program and asked me to ask questions about this program.
Interview Questions: What role did you play in your project?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: It was a zoom call. It started about 15 minutes late because the office had technical issues. It was alright, but felt very rushed and incomplete. The role as they described also felt every different from what the application had described.
Interview Questions: What did you know about Fordham

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: One interview and then reference check . IT was pretty straight forwards. It takes months to hear back to which is kind of annoying . Overall a very quick and easy hiring process.
Interview Questions: Based on the requirements .

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview in person but there were questions in the application that were interview-like. They asked about prior educational and research experience and about our intent in the program.
Interview Questions: How will this program help you achieve your future career goals? What are your research interests?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: It was an amazing process with the faculty president and the head of the Faculty Senate.  Very open about the type of work that was required.  Very funl atmosphere
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Director of Marketing and Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Fordham University in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: The focus of the interview process is success in meeting with the dean and possibly several associate deans. Be prepared to give very specific examples of what you did in your previous work that moved your organization forward.
Interview Questions:
What level of impact did you have on the organization where you worked most recently? What measures did you use to assess that impact?

What are some specific approaches you would use to market our school in the competitive NYC education environment?

How would you define Fordham University's value proposition to prospective students?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: It went very well.  Although I didn't get the position the questions I was asked weren't too difficult to answer and pertinent to the role.  They overall application process was pretty straight forward.  During the interview, they also asked which department I would best fit (i.e University Relations, Admissions).
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work at a University as opposed to another office space.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Professor had a one-to-one meeting with me discussing the responsibilities of the job. Then we discussed about the skills that I had managed and had a brief test on them. Calculations were not needed and mostly were concept questions.
Interview Questions: Do you know deep machine learning?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very casual, one-on-one interview with the Professor who posted the position. Most only want to make sure you're a normal person with a strong work ethic that they can rely on and communicate with easily.
Interview Questions: All questions were behavioral, more of a conversation. Most of the evaluation is completed when you apply. This may vary for more technical positions.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fordham University in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral questions, skillset evaluation, demonstrate some skils with Excel and Power Point, mostly related to some simple formulas and presentations. The interviewer was kind and helpful, and understood my limitations with Excel, volunteering to teach in case I got the position.
Interview Questions: Do you have Excel/VBA skilss?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Fordham University in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an interview just as a formality, but was technically already hired when they called me in for an interview. I was given high preference because I had graduated from Fordham too.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little about yourself

title: Federal Work Study Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer simply asked for past experience and a couple of placement/ field of interest questions. Strengths and weaknesses were asked of, mostly standard interview process. Very friendly, but as it was a work-study position, there was no opportunity to negotiate pay beyond the federally mandated 15 an hour.
Interview Questions:
Strengths and weaknesses
Area of Interest

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Was very short and fast. The interviewer was very kind and just asked me about recent experience with IT related stuff. The interview was about 30 minutes and was pretty easy.
Interview Questions: How  long have you been working with software?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Fordham University in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Few interviews that covered basic topics about the job and expectations. Not very intense. Asked the basic interview questions. Just be prepared to answer about your goals and past experiences.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Someone reached out to me after receiving my resume and contacted me by email. Scheduled a phone interview a few days later.  Told me about the process and did a basic overview of my resume. Asked me about my experiences and how I would benefit the team. Talked about the role but not too in-depth.  2 employees were there, one asking questions and the other verifying. Overall was a good experience.
Interview Questions: Projects

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is not that difficult. You have to continuously look for Graduate assistant jobs on campus, there are many so you can get one easily. The Interview process was Average.
Interview Questions: Tell me about Yourself?

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: Standard process: why you would be a good fit, where do you see yourself in the future, why do you want this job, what are your strengths and weaknesses, etc etc
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit for this position?

title: Library Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Both the director and supervisor of university library interviewed me.  Each of the gentlemen had a series of questions, and I answered accordingly, but what I really appreciated is the thoughtful questions they actually did have, and they actually listened to what I said.

The supervisor preceeded the sit down by giving a tour of the library and explaining the position's responsibilities.
Interview Questions: Who's your hero?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: it was easy and smooth process.  They asked the standard questions and also asked your background like introducing yourself.  They also asked the skillsets and some math questions.  I am in Econ major so that they asked some math questions.
Interview Questions: your background

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: Brief and straightforward. They asked a couple of questions and then told me on the spot that I got  the job. It was a really short interview and I don't know if it was selective but I was the only one chosen
Interview Questions: Describe what makes you a leader

title: Legal Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen. One-on-one interviews in person. Panel interview with a committee of about 4, then an interview with the faculty who you will support. Organized process overall, but it would be nice if some of these interviews could be condensed into the same day.
Interview Questions:
How well do you respond to stress?
How do you feel about being an assistant?

title: Assistant/Associate Director of Graduate Admission Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Overall, it was very long and kind of awkward.  During the final interview, which was over four hours long,  one of the members of the selection  committee referred to Fordham as a lower level school and wondered why I wanted to work for a lower ranked school.   Additionally, any company that has such a lengthy  interview process and wants applicants to jump through so many hoops, should make a prospective employee hesitant.  There were three rounds of interviews - phone selection, in person meeting and tour and then another in person meeting with a presentation.  The lead for the interview committee never made any of his follow up deadlines.
Interview Questions: How long would you be interested in staying in this position?

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: First, there was a phone screening.  During the phone screening, you introduce yourself to the Dean, the Dean informs you of what courses are available for you teach, and arranges a time for you to meet and have your teaching evaluated by other instructors.  You must prepare a short lesson plan on a topic from one of the course you will be teaching.  Then you give a short lecture on that topic.  And finally, you take and answer questions from your audience/interviewers as if they were your students.
Interview Questions: Would you please clarify this specific part of your lecture?

title: Resident Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fordham University in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview felt conversational; which was nice. About 40 mins. No call back or email. A bit unprofessional but not at all surprising in the wonderful world of Higher Education.
Interview Questions: Why Fordham?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
First, reach Professors teaching relevant courses to seek possible GA opportunities by emailing resume. Another way is, submit resume to admission office, waiting for reply. This way is much see efficient. 
After that, attend interviews and meet Professors who are looking for assistant in person. Usually, dressing in suit would be more respectful but some Professors don't like things to be too formal.
There will be just one round interview. The point is to show Professor it's easy and comfortable to work with you.
Interview Questions: What's your availability in this semester?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Fordham University (Bronx, NY) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy. Submitted application and they invited me over to ask where I wanted to work. I had told them anywhere is fine, and I got a job within a couple of weeks. Super simple and you're basically guaranteed a job if there is an opening.
Interview Questions: Where would you want to be placed?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
There was a one on one interview the director of the program. They would ask questions pertaining to one's passion and intent for the class. There is a strong focus on your background and how you can serve as an active role model for the students.

There was a one on one interview the director of the program. They would ask questions pertaining to one's passion and intent for the class. There is a strong focus on your background and how you can serve as an active role model for the students.
Interview Questions: How will you keep the students actively engaged with the topic?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed onsite, total four interviewers interviewed me. each of them talked to me for half an hour. All behavior questions, interviewers ask almost the same questions. very easy and interviewers were very nice. business formal required, turn off your cellphone. they will give you more chance to talk and ask you to ask them questions.
Interview Questions: what will you do if you run into problems at work.

title: Senior Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: Very vague and not enough technical questions. I was hoping to get more hands on experience. Person was late to the interview and that gave a bad impression.Very vague and not enough technical questions. I was hoping to get more hands on experience. Person was late to the interview and that gave a bad impression.
Interview Questions: Where do you yourself in 5 years

title: Fordham Law Library Cataloging Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume and letter of application via email, a few weeks later I was contacted for a phone interview, a few weeks after that, a 5 hour in person interview, with several panels, and several one on one meetings, I got a call a few weeks after that to inform me that I didn't get the position. The entire process (while lengthy) left me with a great impression of everyone who worked in the law library, and gave me a really good understanding of what it would be like to work there. It was very intimidating to have such a lengthy interview process, but I'm really glad that was how they did it.
Interview Questions: Would you regret leaving public services librarianship?

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Fordham University (Bronx, NY) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a quick phone screen then 2 in person interviews. The interviewers were kind and not trying to trick me. They were truly looking for a person with the right personality and fit for the office.
Interview Questions: Do you know about the University's mission?

title: Student Worker - Residential Life Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Fordham University (Bronx, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a student worker position in the summer. The interview was more about my preferences and a discussion of the work done in the office. Before I met with the staff at the residential office, I met with someone at career services who looked at my resume and sent me on this interview.
Interview Questions: Please discuss your previous work experience listed on your resume.

title: IT Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring and interview process for student workers isn't that in-depth.
Typically, at least with this listing / opportunity someone would find the posting for a job, send in the proper or required information, await the response, and then you go in for an impromptu discussion, and typically you start either that week or the following week.
Its really painless, and goes pretty quick.
Interview Questions: What are your expectations and what does your class schedule look like?

title: IT Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fordham University (Bronx, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly thorough, asking about IT experience and requesting that I explain how I would walk someone through different scenarios in-person. The process was mostly conducted as a 1:1 interview, and there were two separate interviews that I needed to go through. One was with HR, while the other was with an IT technician.
Interview Questions: How would you explain the repair process of a printer that is not detected by the computer to someone over the phone?

title: Associate Director of Systems and Data Analytics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I responded to an online job posting by email. I got a response in less than a week, I was asked to come in for a face to face interview. It was a panel interview with three people. The questions were mainly on my experience with analytics, and behavioral questions. I was told that I would hear back in a week. I got a response in a few days that I was not selected.
Interview Questions: We have these 3 different sources of data, how would you work with them and derive insights from them? All behavioral and experience based questions

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fordham University (Bronx, NY) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by several people. I was told I was the best candidate but someone else was offered the job. I wish if they had made the decision before I was brought in to hire someone else they would not have called me in for the interview.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Custodial Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews, constant traveling to meet with hiring team, process took forever, lack of hiring experience. Was really looking forward to a different type of interview experience. Seem like the interview process was put together poorly and just off the fly.
Interview Questions: How much are you looking to make ?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Fordham University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Got asked to do a small programming project in one weekend to prove myself qualified for the coding-related job, and talked 30min about the capability of handling study and work at the same time
Interview Questions: Asked if necessary, would use own off-school time to keep up with the pace to project

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a friend who asked me if I was interested in working in a particular Fordham GBA office.  I was interviewed for a position by my would-be supervisor and a current GA who was working in the same position.
Interview Questions: What would you change about the services offered by our office?

title: Technology Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fordham University (Bronx, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
Applied by email. Called in for the interview by email in 2-3 weeks.  Office assistant is very polite and helpful. First interview was with the director consisting of a combination of case and behavioral interview. Lasted 45 minutes.  I liked the director's attitude. 


Next week, assistant emails for a second interview with a senior guy and a meeting with "Future colleagues" on the same day. The senior guy was just going through the interview for tge sake of it. He even  said that he can influence decisions for the position ( attitude!). His interview was mostly based on my experience.  About 30 mins...
then comes the meeting with colleagues.  There were 4 of them.  All were friendly and approachable. They ecen asked me how I plan to commute giving me the impression that I am a top candidate for them. The meeting with them was casual and informative
.


I left the premises after both interviews about 2 months back.  Still haven't heard anything. I followed up once asking if a decision has been made but never got a reply. Wish they responded since I was one of the top 3 to make it to round 2.

I don't believe in thank you emails since its business - they pay us to work 7-8 hours a day. What to thank employers for? We spend time too meeting with them.
Interview Questions: examples of problem solving, analytical, communication skills. Why fordham

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: There are 2 positions for each yeas GA, and they will choose from 5 candiates
Interview Questions: Most part just get to know you, nothing too hard, but they also look at your past experience and GPA.

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Fordham University (Bronx, NY) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Resume directly to hiring manager. Initial in-person interview one week later. Second interview 6 weeks later. Notification two weeks later via email.
Interview Questions: I know you don't know us, but how would you fit in with us?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Fordham University
Interview Descriptions: I was selected to be a member of the consulting team base on my performance in class.
Interview Questions: no difficult questions

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Fordham University (Bronx, NY) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with two current RAs and a Resident Director. Questions were fairly strait forward, strengths and weaknesses, responding to hypothetical scenarios. Took about 20 minutes, was initially waitlisted and later accepted.
Interview Questions: What is one of your weaknesses?

title: IT Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Fordham University (Bronx, NY) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Just asked for you schedule and gpa. After you will receive an e-mail or phone call telling you to come back in and pick-up your schedule up for work. From then you go through a three day training course.Which just gives you the run down on what you will be doing while working for Fordham IT.
Interview Questions: What is your fall semester schedule?

title: Clerical Staff In Library Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Fordham University (Bronx, NY) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Drawn out and torturous. Interview bordered on abusive mental cruelty. Racist remarks were made in regard to other candidates that were vying for the same position. It felt unlike an interview and much like blackmail. Psychotic future boss conducted the interview, and was so incompetent that it was obvious that she had no idea what she was doing and was completely unprepared. Completely unprofessional.
Interview Questions: "I don't want another lazy one of THEM if you know what I mean, so are you gonna help me? How?"

title: Residence Life Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Fordham University (Bronx, NY) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview and was then asked to come in for an in-person interview.  For the in-person interview, I met with a variety of people one on one as well as students and potential co-workers in a group setting (6 rounds in total).  I was given a campus tour as well.  The interview lasted from 9-5.  Everyone was very friendly and welcoming for the most part.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a rule that we put in place went against your ethical beliefs.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Fordham University in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, I believe, (this was awhile ago) and the entire process was very smooth and simple.  I was contacted by telephone to schedule an in-person interview for shortly thereafter.  When I got the interview, some basic questions were asked, and after I passed the interview the start date was set for the following Monday.
Interview Questions: I wouldn't say that there were any particularly difficult questions, although since I did not have much administrative assistant experience at that point, I did have to explain how I felt I was qualified for the job.

title: Van Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Fordham University (Bronx, NY) in Oct 2008
Interview Descriptions: There is a long "waitlist" as this is the most desirable student position with the highest pay. The interview is not too intense or probing, though there are two test components. First, a written test with 6 questions from the NYS DMV Licensing exam - this sounds easy but the questions are not intuitive for experienced drivers, and it's wiser to study than lose a desirable job for such a silly reason. There is a driving component to the interview, which can be nerve wracking, but they are not too critical- they simply want to see that you're not reckless.
Interview Questions: The NYS driving exam can really through you a curveball, and you need 5/6 questions correct to drive.
